div.l: Oure corne is stolne sothely it is no nay
And we haue hadde an Evyll fitte to day
And sithen I shall haue none amendment
Ageyn my losse I wil haue an esement
By goddis soule it shall none other be
This Iohn answerde Aleyn avise the
This myln̉er is a perelous man he seide
And if he oute of his slepe abrayde
He myght do vs bothe a velanye
Alleyn seide I counte it not a flye
And vp he roos and bi the wenche crepte
This wenche lay vp right and faste slepte
Till he so nyghe was or she myght aspye
That it hadde ben to late forto crye
And shortly forto Say"S" appears altered from an indistinguishable original. they were atone
Nowe play Aleyn for I wil speke of Iohn
This Iohn lay still a forlonge way or twoo
And to hym self compleyneth of his woo
Allas qduod he this is an Euyll Iape
Nowe may I say I am but an ape
Yite has my felawe somwhat for his harme
He has the myln̉ers doughter in his arme
He auentured hym and hath his nedes spedde
And I lye here as a draf sak in my bedde
And when this Iape is tolde another day
I shall be holde a daf and a cokeney
Vnhardy is vncely thus men seith
I wil arise and auenture it in good feith
And vp he roos and softely he wente
Vnto the cradyll and in his hande he hente
And bare it softe vnto his beddes fete
Soone after this wyf hir routyng lete
And gan a wake and went hir forto pisse
And come ageyn and gan hir cradill mysse
And creped hir and there she founde anoone
Allas qduod she I hadde almoste mysgone
I hadde all moste gone to the clerkes bedde
Ey benedicite than hadde I full spedde
And forthe she goth till she the cradill founde
She gropeth all wey firther with hir honde
And founde the bedde and thought nought but good
Be cause that the cradill by it stode
Nought knowyng where she was for it was derke
